physical_appearance:These are two studio portrait photographs of Tan Chong Tee. He is shown dressed in a uniform in both pictures. The uniform features a circular badge on the left shoulder sleeve
 and a rectangular badge on the left collar. The photograph on the left shows him standing on a tiled floor against a plain background
 with his right hand on his hip. The photograph on the right shows him seated
 with only half of his body in the photograph.

sgcool_label_text:This photograph belongs to part of a collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012)
 who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee
 which date from the late 1980s to early 2000s. \r\n\r\nForce 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya

metadata.title_text: Tan Chong Tee Collection: Photograph featuring Tan Chong Tee with note by Colonel Broome ????? Tan Chong Tee Collection: Tan Chong Tee
metadata.physical_appearance: These are two studio portrait photographs of Tan Chong Tee. He is shown dressed in a uniform in both pictures. The uniform features a circular badge on the left shoulder sleeve, and a rectangular badge on the left collar. The photograph on the left shows him standing on a tiled floor against a plain background, with his right hand on his hip. The photograph on the right shows him seated, with only half of his body in the photograph.
metadata.subject_terms_2: World War, 1939-1945 Great Britain. Army. Force 136 Force 136 (Guerilla movement) Chen, Chongzhi, 1916- Portrait photography Soldiers
metadata.subject_terms_3: Force 136 (Guerilla movement) Tan, Chong Tee 1942-1945 Japanese occupation Portrait photography
metadata.sgcool_label_text:
This photograph belongs to part of a collection of artefacts related to the World War II underground resistance movement known as Force 136. The collection of materials was gathered by Tan Chong Tee (1916- 2012), who was a key member of this resistance group. The collection consists of original materials belonging to Tan and other members of Force 136 dating from the 1940s to new materials reproduced from memory by Tan Chong Tee, which date from the late 1980s to early 2000s. 

Force 136 was set up in July 1942 as part of the British Special Operations Executive (SOE). It recruited and trained local guerillas to gather intelligence and create an underground spy network to support planned British invasion of Japanese-occupied Malaya
